Subject: 
Installation of Explosive Detection System at the airports in 
India. 
 
In order to prevent explosives or any other dangerous devices which may 
be used to commit an act of unlawful interference, from being introduced by any 
means whatsoever on board an aircraft engaged in civil aviation operations, 
Explosive Detection system (EDS) shall be installed in the Security Hold Area, 
Hold Baggage and Cargo Screening area at all airports served by civil 
commercial flights in a phased manner by the concerned airport operator in the 
manner as mentioned below: 
 
(i) 
One EDS shall be installed with two X-ray Baggage Inspection 
System. 
(ii) 
If there is only one X-ray BIS, one EDS shall be installed. 
(iii) 
In the first phase, EDS shall be installed at all the hyper sensitive 
and sensitive airports within a period of three months. 
(iv) 
In the second phase EDS shall be installed at all the other airports 
by end of November, 2006. 
(v) 
Trained and BCAS certified screeners shall be deployed for 
operation of the EDS. 
(vi) 
Standards for EDS have already been specified by the BCAS vide 
Circular No. 25/2004 dated 27.12.2004. 
(vii) 
Installation of EDS shall be done in consultation with the concerned 
RDCOS, 
BCAS, 
Aircraft 
Operator 
and 
In-charge 
airport 
management. 
(viii) 
Action taken report shall be sent to the BCAS Hqrs.
